Use: Transparent Tribe has registered domains to mimic file sharing, government, defense, and research websites for use in targeted campaigns. [1] [3] For C0011 , Transparent Tribe registered domains likely designed to appear relevant to student targets in India. [7]

Technique: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic
Use: Transparent Tribe has crafted VBS-based malicious documents. [1] [2] For C0011 , Transparent Tribe used malicious VBA macros within a lure document as part of the Crimson malware installation process onto a compromised host. [7]
Transparent Tribe has compromised domains for use in targeted malicious campaigns. [1]
For C0011 , Transparent Tribe established SSL certificates on the typo-squatted domains the group registered. [7]
Transparent Tribe has used websites with malicious hyperlinks and iframes to infect targeted victims with Crimson , njRAT , and other malicious tools. [1] [6] [3]
Transparent Tribe has used dynamic DNS services to set up C2. [1]
Transparent Tribe has crafted malicious files to exploit CVE-2012-0158 and CVE-2010-3333 for execution. [1]

Technique: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
Use: Transparent Tribe can hide legitimate directories and replace them with malicious copies of the same name. [2]

Technique: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
Use: Transparent Tribe can mimic legitimate Windows directories by using the same icons and names. [2]

Technique: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
Use: Transparent Tribe has dropped encoded executables on compromised hosts. [1]

Transparent Tribe has sent spearphishing e-mails with attachments to deliver malicious payloads. [1] [2] [8] [3] [6] During C0011 , Transparent Tribe sent malicious attachments via email to student targets in India. [7]
Transparent Tribe has embedded links to malicious downloads in e-mails. [8] [3] During C0011 , Transparent Tribe sent emails containing a malicious link to student targets in India. [7]
For C0011 , Transparent Tribe hosted malicious documents on domains registered by the group. [7]
Transparent Tribe has set up websites with malicious hyperlinks and iframes to infect targeted victims with Crimson , njRAT , and other malicious tools. [1] [6] [3]
Transparent Tribe has directed users to open URLs hosting malicious content. [8] [3] During C0011 , Transparent Tribe relied on student targets to click on a malicious link sent via email. [7]

Transparent Tribe has used weaponized documents in e-mail to compromise targeted systems. [1] [2] [8] [3] [6] During C0011 , Transparent Tribe relied on a student target to open a malicious document delivered via email. [7]
